gurmukhi: duh ids pry bIr h`kwr ] kwiF kwiF kiRpwx Dwvq mwr mwr aucwr ]
transliteration: Duh Dis Dare Beer Hakkaar|| Kaadh(i) Kaadh(i) Kridaan Dhaavat Maar Maar Ouchaar||
translation: The warriors fell from both the directions and taking out the swords they marched forward shouting “kill, kill”;

gurmukhi: pwn roks rOK rwvq kRu`D ju`D iPry ] gwih gwih gjI rQI rx AMq BRm igry ]
transliteration: Paan Rokas Raoukh Raavat Kruddh Juddh Phire|| Gadh(i) Gadh(i) Gadirathiran Ant Bhram Gire||
translation: Holding their weapons in their hands, the angry warriors wandered and killing the elephant-drivers and the charioteers, they ultimately fell down on the earth;

gurmukhi: qwn qwn sMDwn bwn pRmwn kwn subwh ] bwih bwih iPry sbwhn C`qR Drm inbwih ]
transliteration: Taan Taan Sandaaan Baan Pramaan Kaan Soubaah|| Baah(i) Baah(i) Phire Sabaahan Chhattra Dharam Nibaah(i)||
translation: Pulling the bows upto their ears, they discharged the arrows and in this way, striking the blows with their weapons, they fulfilled the obligation of Kashatriyas;

gurmukhi: byD byD su bwn AMg juAwn jUJy AYs ] BUir BwrQ ky smy sr syj BIKm jYs ]37]111]
transliteration: Bedh Bedh Su Baan An Juaan Joojhe Ais|| Bhoor(i) Bhaarath Ke Same Sar Saj Bheekham||37||111||
translation: Being pierced by the arrows, the warriors fell like the falling of Bhishma on the bed of arrows in the time of Arjuna.37.111.

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD bhuqu sMnXwsI mwry ] kyiqk bwND bwr mo bory ikqy Agn mO jwry ]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Bahout(i) Sannyaasimdare|| Ketik Baandh Baar Mo Bore Kite Agad Man Jdare||
translation: In this way, many Snnyasis were killed; many were tied and got drowned and many were burnt in fire;

gurmukhi: kyqn eyk hwQ kt fwry kyiqk ky dÍY hwQ ] iql iql pwie rQI kit fwry kty ikqn ky mwQ ]
transliteration: Ketan Ek Haath Kat Dare Ketikke Dvai Haath|| Til Til Paae Rathikattee Dare Kitan Ke Maath||
translation: There were many whose one hand was cut and there were many others whose two hand were cut; many charioteers were torn into pieces and the heads of many were chopped;

gurmukhi: CqR cmR rQ bwj ikqn ky kwit kwit rx fwry ] kyqn mukt lkut lY qory kyqn jUt aupwry ]
transliteration: Chhatra Chamra Rath Baaj Kitan Ke Kaattee Kaattee Ran Dare|| Ketan Moukat Lakout Lai Tore Kitan Jeet Oupdare||
translation: The canopies, fly-whisks, chariots, horses etc. of many were chopped in the battlefield; the crowns of many were broken with staff and the knots of the matted locks of many were uprooted;

gurmukhi: Bik Bik igry iBMBr bsuDw pr Gwie AMg iBBkwry ] jwnuk AMq bsMq sBY imil cwcr Kyl isDwry ]38]112]
transliteration: Bhak(i) Bhak(i) Gire Bhinbhar Basudhaa Par Ghaae An Bhibhkdare|| Jaanouk Ant Basant Sabhai Mil(i) Chaachar Khel Sidhdare||38||112||
translation: Many were wounded and fell on the earth and from their limbs, the blood oozed out as if all were playing Holi in spring season.38.112.

gurmukhi: cup ry cwr ickny kys ] Awn Awn iPrI chUM ids nwr nwgr bys ]
transliteration: Choup Re Chaar Chikne Kes|| Aan Aan Phirichahoon Dis Naar Naagad Bes||
translation: The heavenly damsels gathered together in the battlefield from all the four directions after dressing their hair;
